name: image_file
description: File name needs to be unique

name: image_type
description: Image type should be SEM, Visual, or Fluorescence

name: researcher_name
description: The name of the researcher or the name of the lab must not be an 'NA'

name: affiliation
description: The name of the institute where the researcher is from must not be an 'NA'
valid_example: Moore Institute for Plastic Pollution Research

name: citation
description: The citation must not be an 'NA'
valid_example: Lattin and Moore 2020, Interlab Comparison Study Data, Moore Institute for Plastic Pollution Research

name: instrument_name
description: The full name of the instrument
rule: InstrumentName %in% c("Nikon SMZ1270", "NA", "MEIJI TECHNO EMZ-8TR with OptixCAM summit K2", "Olympus MVX-ZB10")

name: analysis_date
description: The year the image was analyzed

name: polymer_type_of_particle
description: The polymer of the particle should fit within one of these categories: NA, Polyethylene, Polystyrene, Nylon, Polypropylene, Organic Matter, Other Plastic, PE, PS, cellulose, PET, PVC, Mineral

name: polymer_type_of_particle_original
description: If the original polymer type is not within the polymer categories, it will appear as a warning

name: magnification
description: Magnification of the analysis must be written as a number or with an 'x' after

name: color
description: The color of the particle should fit within one of these categories: Green, White, Black, Transparent, Pink, Blue, Grey, Purple, Red, Yellow, Orange, Brown, Other, Unknown

name: color_original
description: If the original color is not within one of the color categories, it will appear as a warning

name: morphology
description: The morphology of the particle should fit within one of these categories: Sphere, Film, Fiber, Fragment, Foam, Fiber Bundle, Bead, Nurdle, NA

name: morphology_original
description: If the original morphology is not within one of the morphology categories, it will appear as a warning

name: size_of_particle
description: The size of the particle should fit within one of these size classes: >500 um, 20-212 um, 1-20 um, 212-500 um, <500 um, 50-250 um, >1 mm, 100-500um, 1.5mm, >500, >3mm, ~2mm, ~1mm, 2mm, 3mm, ~3mm, >500um, NA

name: size_dimension
description: The name of the size used to describe the plastic rather than the exact dimensions

name: MicroplasticImages
description: Name of image must be correct
